body_html: Recent versions of TensorFlow have applied more aggressive constant folding. Both of your custom op implementations are stateless (ignoring the side effect of their LOG messages), so they may be subject to constant folding. To inhibit constant folding for each op add .SetIsStateful() to the end of the REGISTER_OP() builder.
body_text: Recent versions of TensorFlow have applied more aggressive constant folding. Both of your custom op implementations are stateless (ignoring the side effect of their LOG messages), so they may be subject to constant folding. To inhibit constant folding for each op add .SetIsStateful() to the end of the REGISTER_OP() builder.
body: Recent versions of TensorFlow have applied more aggressive constant folding. Both of your custom op implementations are stateless (ignoring the side effect of their `LOG` messages), so they may be subject to constant folding. To inhibit constant folding for each op add `.SetIsStateful()` to the end of the `REGISTER_OP()` builder.
